defs: (fig.) the art or performing skill of producing baffling effects or illusions by sleight of hand, concealed apparatus, etc.; magic.
the use of false representations to gain an unjust advantage; dishonest artifice or trick; fraud.
any of an order (Chiroptera) of furry, nocturnal flying mammals having membranous wings and navigating by echolocation, which feed on insects, nectar, fruit, flesh or blood; a chiropter: a bat.
= ಕಣುಕಪ್ಪಟೆ.
to see; to perceive through the eyes.
to get a clear mental impression of; grasp by thinking; to understand.
(fig.) a furious look.
to have furious look at.
a mark, sign or a thing seeing which one can remember something or understand the intention.
to lose sharpness of one's vision.
to be utterly perplexed or confused; to be bewildered.
to be alarmed, agitated or upset; to be disturbed or troubled greatly; to be perturbed.
(the eye) to become fatigued; to be fully satisfied (seeing a pleasant thing).
the state or condition of being invisible.
shining or lustre of the eye.
a children's game in which one player tries to find the other players, who have hidden; hide-and-seek.
a pouring down of tears; a weeping with profuse tears.
= ಕಣಿವೆ.
a pain in the eye.
(fig.) an object of envy; the envious feeling.
(fig.) a thing that is unpleasant to look at; an eye-sore.
a sign made with the eye.
a twig, slender branch; a stick.
a slender pointed missile shot from a bow, usu. feathered and barbed; an arrow.
a long, stiff, sharp spine of a porcupine that can be erected.
a long bamboo staff.
a stick with zigzag surfaced head at one end, used to stir, beat or shake curd in a churn to make butter; a churn-stick.
a slender shaft with a pointed tip and other end being feathered used to be shot from a bow; an arrow.
an old unit for measuring the area of a land.
a stick of standard length used for this purpose.
the heavy wood or stone which by revolving in a mortar grinds oil-seeds to extract oil, in a bullock-driven oil mill.
a long pole with a broad blade at one end used for propelling or steering a boat; an oar.
the slender, jointed stem of plants as sugarcane, jowar, etc.
the long beam of the plough.
any of the farm implements, as plough, etc.; an agricultural implement.
a knot tied to hold the sari at the waist.
a distinguishing voice of a singer or sound of a musical instrument.
[a wrong form of ಕಡೆ3] the last stage; the final point of time (of one's life, existence, etc.); the time of death, destruction, etc.; conclusion; finish.
the last part of anything; the boundary or the district along the boundary; border; edge; margin.
an indiclinable denoting 'you know!' (while addressing girls or women younger to oneself).
the climber Piper longum of Piperaceae family.
any undesired, uncultivated plant, esp. one growing in profusion so as to crowd out a desired crop, disfigure a lawn, etc.; a weed.
the front portion of the leg from the knee to the ankle.
to discharge or pour forth arrows in a shower.
darkness caused by thick shower of arrows.

to discharge or pour forth arrows.

a kind of weapon.

the right, duty or opportunity to do something, esp. as coming to each of a number of people in regular order; a turn.
the general way, manner of social life in a society; established custom.
place; room; space.
the sloping edge of land by a river; a bank.
to shoot an arrow or arrows.
a wound caused by the shot of an arrow.
to be broken by the shot of an arrow.
any of various relatively large rodents having stiff sharp erectile bristles mingled with the hair and constituting a family Hystricidae; a porcupine.
an indiclinable denoting 'you know!' (while addressing boys or men).

to overpower or dim the vision of with very bright light, moving lights, pop, ostentatious display.
a narrow rift or a hole of very small diameter to see through.

range or field of vision.
an approximating of quantity, numbers, weight, etc. by just looking (instead of ascertaining by actual measure, weighment, counting etc.); a rough estimate.

ಕಣ್ಣೀರಲ್ಲಿ ಕೂಳುತಿನ್ನು kaṇṇīralli kūḷu tinnu to live a miserable life; ಕಣ್ಣೀರಲ್ಲಿ ಕೈತೊಳೆ kaṇṇīralli kai toḷe to live a very difficult life; ಕಣ್ಣೀರು ಕಪಾಳಕ್ಕೆ ಬರು kaṇṇīru kapāḷakke baru to be very difficult, very trying or annoying.
the act of shedding tears.
the organ of vision; the eye.
a look; glance; gaze.

a thing like an eye in appearance or function as - a) a bud of a tuber, as a potato; b) the spot on a peacock's tail feather; c) the threading hole in a needle; d) a hole in a tool, as for a handle; e) a mark or spot on the surface of a die; f) the hole or space left open in a net; g) a hole; a cavity; an eyelet.
the small opening between nail and the finger or toe.
(fig.) the important, attractive and vital part of anything.
the excellent, superior thing in the class or group.
(fig.) compassionate feeling or treatment; kindness; mercy.
the supposed power of a look causing harm to the person or object looked at.
the central portion of any percussion instrument, where it is played with fingers; the black dough pasted on there; ಕಣ್ಣ ಬಿನದ kaṇṇa binada the pleasure brought by pleasant sight.

(a title) he whose presence brings joy; ಕಣ್ಣ ಮೆಯ್ಯ kaṇna meyya an epithet of Indra, the Lord or gods; ಕಣ್ಣಲಾಗೆನೆ kaṇṇalāgene very quickly; within a wink; ಕಣ್ಣಿಗೆ ಎಣ್ಣೆ ಬಿಟ್ಟುಕೊಂಡು ಕೆಲಸಮಾಡು/ಹುಡುಕು kaṇṇalli eṇṇehākikoṇḍu kelasa māḍu/huḍuku (fig.) to work throughout (without a break)/ examine or search for (something) very carefully; to watch without winking; ಕಣ್ಣಲ್ಲಿ ಒತ್ತು kaṇṇalli ottu to be a visually offensive or ugly thing; (an object belonging to another) to cause envious feeling; ಕಣ್ಣಲ್ಲಿ ಕಣ್ಣಿಟ್ಟು ನೋಡು kaṇṇalli kaṇṇiṭṭu nōḍu to look at another's eyes (to know latter's mind). 2. to watch, probe, very carefully for something; ಕಣ್ಣಲ್ಲಿ ರಕ್ತ ಬರು kaṇṇalli rakta baru to work very hard; ಕಣ್ಣಾಗು kaṇṇāgu to look desirously at; 2. to become the object of attraction; 3. to be another's guide; to lead another ; 4. to be affected by conjunctivitis (inflammation of the conjunctive of the eye); ಕಣ್ಣಾಡಿಸು kaṇṇaḍisu to have a look at;

to glance through (usu. cursorily); to run through (a book, passage,etc.); 3) to signal by winking; ಕಣ್ಣಿಗೆ ಇಂಗು ಹಚ್ಚು k aṇṇige ingu haccu (fig.) to cheat; to deceive; ಕಣ್ಣಿಗೆ ಕಣ್ಣು ಹತ್ತು k aṇṇige k aṇṇu hattu to sleep; ಕಣ್ಣಿಗೆ ಕತ್ತಲೆ ಬರು k aṇṇu k attale baru (the mind) to become blank; to feel dizzy; to have a sensation of spinning or whirling; to faint; to lose consciousness temporarily; ಕಣ್ಣಿಗೆ ಬೀಳು k aṇṇige bīḷu to be seen, observed; ಕಣ್ಣಿಗೆ ಮಣ್ಣೆರಚು k aṇṇige maṇṇeracu (fig.) to cheat; to deceive; ಕಣ್ಣಿಗೆ ಮಣ್ಣೆಸೆ/ಮಣ್ಣೆರಚು k aṇṇige maṇṇese/ maṇṇeracu (fig.) to mislead or deceive someone; to throw dust in someone's eyes;ಕಣ್ಣಿಗೆ ಹಬ್ಬವಾಗಿರು k aṇṇige habbavāgiru to be very pleasant to look at; to feast one's eyes; ಕಣ್ಣಲ್ಲಿ ರಕ್ತ ಬರು k aṇṇinalli rakta baru to undergo very muh hardship; to work very hard; ಕಣ್ಣು ಕಣ್ಣುಬಿಡು k aṇṇu k aṇṇu biḍu (fig.) to blink in a baffling stuation; to be baffled; ಕಣ್ಣು ಕತ್ತಲಿಡು k aṇṇu k attaliḍu = ಕಣ್ಣಿಗೆ ಕತ್ತಲೆ ಬರು; ಕಣ್ಣು ಕತ್ತಲೆ k aṇṇu k attale a fainting or loss of consciousness, caused by a temporary deficiency of blood supply to the brain; syncope; ಕಣ್ಣುಕೂಡು k aṇṇukūḍu to sleep.

(eyes of beloved ones) to meet; (lovers) to have mutually amorous look; ಕಣ್ಣುಕೂರು k aṇṇukūru = ಕಣ್ಣುಕೂಡು; ಕಣ್ಣು ಕೀಳದಿರು k aṇṇu k īḷadiru to not stop looking at (something attractive, interesting etc.); ಕಣ್ಣು ಕೆಂಪಾಗು k aṇṇu k empāgu (fig.) to be furious; to be enrage.

(fig.) (fig.) to get wisdom; ಕಣ್ಣು ಬಿಡು k aṇṇu biḍu to open one's eyes; to see.

(one's evil look, malicious intention) to affect adversely on;ಕಣ್ಣು ಮಿಟುಕಿಸು k aṇṇu miṭukisu to wink.

(one's evil look) to cause evil (to another); ಕಣ್ಣುಹಾಕು k aṇṇu hāku to cast amorous glance.
to look enviously at.

to graft a bud of a tuber into another's; to inoculate; ಕಣ್ಣುಹಾಯಿಸು k aṇṇu hāyisu to look casually at; to have a cursory look; to glance; ಕಣ್ಣುಹೊಡೆ k aṇṇu hoḍe = ಕಣ್ಣು ಮಿಟುಕಿಸು; ಕಣ್ಣು ಹೋಗು k aṇṇu hōgu (one's power of vision) to be lost; ಕಣ್ಣೊರಸುವ ಮಾತು/ತಂತ್ರ k aṇṇorasuva mātu/tantra (fig.) something said or done merely for appearance or effect; humbug; an eyewash; ಮೈಯೆಲ್ಲಾ ಕಣ್ಣಾಗಿರು maiyellā k aṇṇāgiru (fig.) to be very vigilant; to be extremely attentive; to be all eyes; ಒಂದು ಕಣ್ಣಿಗೆ ಬೆಣ್ಣೆ, ಒಂದು ಕಣ್ಣಿಗೆ ಸುಣ್ಣ ಹಚ್ಚು ondukaṇṇige beṇṇe, ondu k aṇṇige suṇṇa haccu to treat one fairly and another unfairly; to be biased; ತನ್ನ ಕಣ್ಣನ್ನು ತಾನೇ ನಂಬದಿರು tanna kaṇṇannu tānē nambadiru (fig.) to find it dificult to believe whether something seen is real or not; to be not able to believe one's eyes; ಕೆಟ್ಟ ಕಣ್ಣು keṭṭa kaṇṇu (fig.) an eye or glance held capable of inflicting harm; ಕಣ್ಣು ಇರುವವರೆಗೆ ನೋಟ, ಕಾಲು ಇರುವವರೆಗೆ ಓಟ kaṇṇu iruvavarege nōṭa, kālu iruvavarege ōṭa one can be effective as long as one has required means and resource; once wings are lost, no bird can fly; ಕಣ್ಣುಕಾಣದ ಹೊಟ್ಟೆಗೆ ಮಣ್ಣೇನು, ಮಸಿಯೇನು? kaṇṇu kāṇada hoṭṭege maṇṇēnu, masiyēnu? hunger blinds one's discretion.
